sen.e: Mitsuyoshi KIRA (year of birth unknown - October 17, 1356) was a busho (Japanese military commander) lived during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

sen.j: 元弘の乱で倒幕の兵を挙げた足利尊氏に従い、京都の六波羅探題攻撃に参加。
sen.e: Following Takauji ASHIKAGA who raised an army to overthrow the Shogunate in the Genko War, Mitsuyoshi participated in the attack of Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto) in Kyoto.

sen.j: 倒幕後に建武の新政が開始されると、足利直義に従い関東に下向し、元弘4年/建武 (日本)元年（1334年）正月には関東廂番六番頭人に任命された（一族である吉良貞家も三番頭人に任命されている）。
sen.e: Once Kenmu Restoration started after overthrowing the Shogunate, he left the capital for Kanto region following Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA and was appointed to the 6th tonin (the director) of Kanto hisashiban the first days of New Year in 1334 (Sadaie KIRA, a member of the clan, was also appointed to the 3rd tonin).

sen.j: 建武2年（1335年）2月、信濃国で北条氏残党が活動を始めると、これを鎮圧するため、一族の吉良時衡を信濃へ派遣した。
sen.e: As the remaining group of the Hojo clan went into action in Shinano Province in February of 1335, he dispatched Tokihira KIRA, a member of the clan, to Shinano for the suppression.

sen.j: 時衡は信濃守護小笠原貞宗とともに軍を指揮したが、鎮圧は成功せず北条勢の武蔵国進出を許してしまい、これが鎌倉陥落へと繋がる（中先代の乱）。
sen.e: Although Tokihira commanded an army with Shinano Shugo (provincial constable) Sadamune OGASAWARA, they could not suppress and allowed Hojo forces to advance into Murashi Province, which led to a fall of Kamakura (the Nakasendai War).

sen.j: 乱が勃発した時点での満義の居所は不明だが、以降、建武3年/延元元年（1336年）の南北朝の分裂までの間、尊氏・直義に従い各地を転戦する。
sen.e: The whereabouts of Mitsuyoshi at a point in time the war broke out was unknown, but afterwards, he took part in various battles following Takauji and Tadayoshi until a split of Northern and Southern Dynasties in 1336.

sen.e: After participated in the Aonogahara War in Mino Province in January of 1338, he seems to have been held the position of Shinano Shugo from 1340 through next year.

sen.e: He assumed the post of the first tonin at Hikitsukekata (office of adjudicants) of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in March of 1344 to support the affairs of state for Tadayoshi.

sen.j: 直義が満義に寄せる信頼は非常に厚く、直義の嫡男である如意丸は、貞和3年/正平 (日本)2年（1347年）6月8日、二条京極にあった満義の邸宅で誕生している。
sen.e: Since Tadayoshi had greatly put his trust in Mitsuyoshi, Tadayoshi's legitimate child Nyoimaru was born at Mitsuyoshi's residence located in Nijo-kyogoku on June 8, 1347.
